overview.ovdesc:
OVERVIEW OF MISCELLANEOUS DEALS - MAIN FILE
The Miscellaneous Deals module provides the facility to record deals which are off balance sheet. The principal amounts involved are booked as contingent entries. Facilities are provided for making charges and printing advices and confirmations. Limit checking is supported.
In the event of participation entered in the Deal, the same may be recorded to the extent of participation. Although when a Deal is participated, movement of principal is not permitted, yet when ASSET.LIAB.NETTING is set to YES, such a movement of principal would be permitted. Such a flag also decides the amount for which contingent entry would be raised either for the Deal amount or to the extent of T24 Bank's participation.
Charges maybe taken online or scheduled for a future date. Whenever, an event is scheduled for a future date in MD, the system updates the same in a file MD.SCHEDULES.
Concurrently, where the User chooses to collect commission the same is permitted. The option on collection of these, however remains with the user. Charge and Commission collection are mutually exclusive. Tax may also be attached to such a Charge or Commission.
In relation to commission, it can either be taken upfront or at the end of the Contract. The system either amortizes or accrues the same in the frequency as defined in the parameter. This scheduling of Commission can either be in terms of manual schedule or defined as a frequency. It is but imperative that Commission debit account is always in the Deal currency.
This commission may either be taken as a percentage of a fixed amount. When set as a percentage, the option to input a spread is available. By defining the appropriate MD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION, it is possible to define a minimum commission amount for a Deal. This definition can also be done currency-wise.
As MD, can be used for issuance of Guarantee, the system permits the user to collect Cash Margin for the same. Such a Cash Margin may be collected at the time of positive principal movement or any time online.
In the event of a Principal decrease, the system permits release of cash margin on the event date. Release of provision (Cash Margin) could be carried out online or any future date as well.
Such a cash margin, maybe taken in a currency different from that of the Deal currency and maybe parked in an account of different currency. An option to define a default MD Margin account is available in the parameter. In the event of such a margin taken, the user may choose to decide as the whether such margin should have an impact on the limit line or not.
The commission input in the Deal is not changeable, however by defining the Deal Sub Type and the Category, the rate change may be effected through the application MD.CSN.RATE.CHANGE. It also enables a retrospective rate change.
The support to MT760, MT767, MT768 and MT769 is available.
In the event of a Guarantee being requested to be issued by a correspondent Bank, an option is available to impact the limit of Correspondent Bank, besides the applicant customer.
Invocation of guarantee is supported along with the requisite messaging, appropriating the Provision and the share of participation if any. Where the invocation results in overdraft of a customer account, the PD link has been provided.
Although the contingent entries are generated at End of Day, there is an option to trigger the same online. This when set, generates the movement entries at Start of Day. The maturity however is done only at End of Day.
If MD, were to be used to issue a shipping guarantee, the system supports appropriation of Cash margin taken in LC into that of MD. The requisite LC reference and the appropriation amount has to be decided by the user. Thus when a Drawing is done under the Letter of Credit, quoting the reference of the MD.DEAL, the system understands the link and generates the accounting accordingly.
Link to Syndicated Loans:
When a Guarantee Deal is linked to Syndicated Loans, input of SL ref in the Deal triggers the requisite validations. This link to SL module is enabled only for issue of Guarantee (CA) type. Firstly, Facility should have been marked as available and its status is set as CUR. The customer of the MD.DEAL should have been defined as that of Facility or one of its allowed Customers. The currency defined in the Deal, should either be a permitted currency of the Facility or should not have been defined as a restricted currency. On input of amount, the system validates, the permitted or available amount in the referred Tranche of the Facility and this validation also caters to the exposure of each of the participants if exist in the Facility. Likewise the Date of the Deal cannot be prior to start of the Tranche Date under which it is drawn. Currently no Principal movement is permitted for such linked Deals.
If charges were to be taken, the same is permissible only in cases where a linked deal is devoid of Participants. In cases, where participation exists in these Deals, the charges are to be collected from SL charges.
When linked the Commission shall always be that of End type and the rate for the Deal currency would either be picked up Facility if found to be of the same currency, if not as defined in SL.FACI.RATES. The user has the option to amend the system defaulted rate. The commission shall always be collected as a frequency as defined in the Facility for Interest (
INT.DUE.DATE). In the event of tax being defined in the Facility, the same is defaulted in Tax key. The limit line shall also be impacted as defined in the relevant Facility. The accrual of commission shall continue to happen as it does for a normal deal with participation. In cases where a participant needs to be added to the Deal, it is imperative that such details are already incorporated in the Facility. In the event of Deal, being participated, the
ASSET.LIAB.NETTING field shall always be defaulted to YES. The
NET.PRIN.AMOUNT shall always denote the own Bank component of the Facility.
Although, in the event of Facility having its share of Participants, the MD.DEAL, may be amended to hold the share in a proportion different from that of the Facility. The default however, would be the distribution of Deal amount in the same ratio as in Facility. But at all times the exposure shall validate against the relevant files in the SL module, viz., SL.EXPOSURE.LEVEL, SL.FACI.BALANCES and SL.FACI.PART.BALANCES.
It is important to note that the field
SL.FUNCTION in the PRE.SYNDICATION.FILE determines the permit of Own Banks share in the Deal. The Deal currency and Deal amounts of Guarantee shall comply with the
TR.MAX.LOANS, TR.MAX.CURRENCY, DD.MULT.AMOUNT, DD.MIN.AMOUNT and
DD.MAX.AMOUNT as defined under the said Tranche of the Facility.

Charges can be defined on any date provided it is not before the deal VALUE.DATE or after the MATURITY.DATE. All charges for a given date must be taken in the same currency and debited to the same account. Charges can be taken in any currency provided that the account to be debited is in the CHARGE.CURR. Any taxes on the charges will be debited to the CHARGE.ACCOUNT.

The charges will be debited during the end of day of the CHARGE.DATE except when the CHARGE.DATE is before the next working day in which case they will be taken on line. Once this has happened the charge details will be removed from the 'live' record but can be seen by looking into the balances file.
NB, If a deal is reversed, relevant charges taken will be reversed.

SPLIT.COMMISSION

If this field is set to YES, the calculated commission will be split into two parts, one proportionate to the leader's share in the Deal that is reflected in the P&L and the other will be credited to the Internal account as specified in the MD.PARAMETER (Field PART.CSN.ACC).
If set to NO, the entire commission, including that relating to the Participants will move into the P&L.
If set to NULL, the flow would be that of NO.
Valid input YES or NO.
Indicates whether limits are to be updated or not.

The interface to limits can be controlled both at the contract and parameter level. At the module parameter level fields are provided to control the use of limits with contingent and memorandum contract types. Via these fields the user can specify if the interface to limits is mandatory, optional or not allowed for these products. The fields used on MD.PARAMETER that do this are:

CONT.LIMIT.LINK Can be Mandatory, Optional or Noinput. MEMO.LIMIT.LINK Can be Mandatory, Optional or Noinput. CL.LIMIT.LINK Can be Mandatory, Optional or Noinput. ML.LIMIT.LINK Can be Mandatory, Optional or Noinput.
If this field is set to YES then limit processing will be perfomed and the limit type define in LIMIT.PARAMETER will be used.
If set to No then no processing is done.
Input must either be 'YES' or 'NO' Default of No is used when limits are set to Noinput in MD.PARAMETER
AUTO.EXPIRY
Deal level decision field for controlling the expiry of the Deal past its Maturity date. Effectively the reversal of Contingent entries are controlled by this field.
If set to YES, the Deal will expire on the date specified in the MATURITY.DATE. If set to NO, the STATUS of the Deal will be held as 'CUR' even past the Maturity Date.
Defaults from EXPIRY.MODE in the MD.PARAMETER.
Valid input YES or NO.
INCLUDE.PROVISION
Deal level decision to control the impact of Cash Margin on the corresponding limit.
If set to YES, the impact on the limit will be reduced to the extent of Cash Margin taken in the Deal, proportionate to the Leader's portion.
If set to NO, irrespective of any Cash Margin taken in the Deal, the limit line would reflect the entire amount of the Leader's portion.
Will default the value from INCLUDE.PROVISION set in the MD.PARAMETER.
Valid input YES or NO.

This field allows the user to suppress any advices that would otherwise be produced over the lifetime of the deal.
If this field is set to 'NO' then no advices will be produced.
If it is set to 'YES' then a subset of the following advices will be produced in association with the deal during its lifetime.
1 Confirmation of Deal 2 Amendment of Deal 3 Cancellation of Deal 4 Charge confirmations

Contract confirmation will be produced only on initial input of the contract and cancellation confirmations only when a contract is reversed. Contract amendment confirmations will be produced whenever the contract principal is amended, i.e. when a principal increase or decrease is entered on the deal. It is important to note that this advice is produced when the amendment is made and not on the value date of the actual movement. Therefore, if a second principal movement is entered before the first has reached its value date both movements will appear on the confirmation. Similarly, whenever the maturity date is amended an amendment confirmation will be produced.
Charge advices will be produced whenever charges are debited, i.e. on the charge value date.
Input of 'YES' or 'NO' only. (Defaults to 'YES')

At contract level the commission amount payable or receivable can be set to be levied at the beginning (BEGIN) of the commission period or the end (END) of the commission period.

The commission period is defined by the start of the contract and the end of the contract with optional interim dates specified by the user. If commission is defined then there must be either a schedule for the start date (for BEGIN contracts) or at maturity (for END contracts).
Where it is set to END:

Accruals are passed to a P/L category according to the cycling frequency and the customer is debited (or credited according to deal type) at the end of the period. For the bank the effect of the P/L is built up over the life of the contract rather than one lump payment at the end.
Where it is set to BEGIN:

Accruals are passed to a P/L category according to the cycling frequency and the customer is debited (or credited according to deal type) at the start of the period. This amount is then left in an advance P/L account and then dripped through to the real P/L. This gives the same effect of the P/L build up over the life of the contract as the END method.
BEGIN - payment in advance
END - payment in arrears
Default is END

A number generated automatically by the system which identifies either a statement entry or a category entry in respect of a contract.

Whenever charges are debited to the customer accounts Miscellaneous Deals will raise accounting entries,. The IDs of these entries both STMT.ENTRY and CATEG.ENTRY, consist of a date- time stamp and a sequence number. All entries raised by a particular transaction will have the same date-time stamp but different sequence numbers.

This field has multi values that are linked in groups of three. The first contains the base date-time stamp which is common to all entries, the second the sequence numbers of the STMT.ENTRY raised and the third the sequence numbers of any CATEG.ENTRYs.
An example will illustrate the field more clearly:
A miscellaneous deal is debited charges from a customer account which are credited to P/L. The system will generate a statement entry and record the ID of this entry as follows:
The number automatically generated in field 37.1 is unique to the deal in question and is build in the following way:
1 The first four digits '6737' indicate the number of days since 1st of January 1968.
In our example it corresponds to the 11th of June 1986.
2 The next five digits '32684' indicate the number of seconds since midnight.
In our example it corresponds to an entry generated on line at 09:04:44
3 The last two digits '48' indicate the number of hundredths of seconds.
The value assigned (again automatically) to field 37.2 identifies the number of in fielf 37.1 as a statement entry number. This entry can be seen via the STMT.ENTRY application using the ID:
The suffix '0001' identifies it as the first statement entry.
Similarly there will be an entry on the CATEG.ENTRY as there is a value in field 37.3. The ID will be:
To view these entries the STMT.ENTRY and the CATEG.ENTRY applications should be used.

Input of YES in this field shall ensure that the maturity of the Guarantee Deal is done Online. This is an input field only if the EVENTS.PROCESSING is set as ONLINE. The Maturity would be treated as TODAY.
When set Online maturity, the commission accounting entries, Limit reinstatement, Release of Cash Margin are all done online along with liquidation of the Contract.

Where the commission is Begin type and Manual and if the Deal were not in its last schedule, the User needs to delete all the future schedules. The accounting entries would however be passed for the entire schedule amount.

Where the commission is End type and Manual and if the Deal were not in its last schedule, the User needs to delete all the future schedules and the CSN.DATE has to be input with Current date. The accounting entries would however be passed only for the amount accrued till date.
Thus commission accounting entries passed for the Begin type would always be for the entire current schedule and that of the End type would always be for the Accrued amount.
When the Commission is set as a frequency, the system would set the CAPITALIZE.DATE as TODAY and the entries would be passed accordingly.
When set to Online maturity the Deal shall not have any Principal movements scheduled.
When set to Online maturity the Deal shall not have any Charges scheduled for a future date.
When set to Online maturity the Deal shall not have Invocation set to Process, Execute or Cancel.
When set to Online maturity the Deal shall not have its Overdue status relating to PD.
Online Maturity shall not take place when the contract is linked to Syndicated Loans.
Online Maturity shall not take place where the contract is linked to LC, but Drawings under the same are yet to be done.
Online Maturity shall not be permitted for any Forward Deals.

When commission has been entered there must be a date or series of dates when the commission will be levied. The validation depends on whether the CSN.PAYMENT.TYPE is entered as BEGIN or END.

The commission period is defined by the start of the contract and the end of the contract with optional interim dates specified by the user. If commission is defined then there must be either a schedule for the start date (for BEGIN contracts) or at maturity (for END contracts).
Where it is set to END:

Accruals are passed to a P/L category according to the cycling frequency and the customer is debited (or credited according to deal type) at the end of the period. For the bank the effect of the P/L is built up over the life of the contract rather than one lump payment at the end.
Where it is set to BEGIN:

Accruals are passed to a P/L category according to the cycling frequency and the customer is debited (or credited according to deal type) at the start of the period. This amount is then left in an advance P/L account and then dripped through to the real P/L. This gives the same effect of the P/L build up over the life of the contract as the END method.
If the CSN.PAYMENT.TYPE is 'BEGIN' then the first schedule's CSN.DATE must be deal value date
If the CSN.PAYMENT.TYPE is 'END' then the LAST schedule's CSN.DATE must be deal maturity date

Must be a valid amount
This is the amount used in the call to limits.

The principal amount used for the purposes of limits will be the highest value of the contract either today or in the future taking into account all principal movements. For example consider the following contingent asset contract:

2 CURRENCY USD 4 PRINCIPAL 1,000,000 6 VALUE.DATE 01/01/93 7 MATURITY.DATE 01/04/93 13.1 PRIN.MOVEMENT - 200,000 14.1 MOVEMENT DATE 15/01.93 13.2 PRIN.MOVEMENT 500,000 14.2 MOVEMENT.DATE 01/02/93 13.3 PRIN.MOVEMENT - 100,000 14.3 MOVEMENT.DATE 01/03/93
In this case the principal amount passed to limits would be 1,300,000 as this is the highest value of the principal throughout the contract life. Hence the LIMIT.AMOUNT field would contain 1,300,000.
This field will only be updated if LIMIT.UPD.REQD is 'YES'.

This field identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. The default for all contracts is AUTOMATIC.
There are three options available:
AUTOMATIC - will liquidate across the charge/commission account on the contract
SEMI AUTOMATIC - will liquidate the charge/commission to the account only if sufficient balance is available. Else, PD will be written
MANUAL - will create a PD contract irrespective of availability of funds
Only the charges and commissions taken in the deal are reckoned for this purpose.
If PD product is not defined for the current company, the only allowed value is AUTOMATIC.
Prior to inputting MANUAL or SEMI AUTOMATIC, a Parameter for MD has to be defined in PD.PARAMETER
